column4: hey all i am using fc6 but the command is the same i would think could i have help mounting a unix cd
mount -t 9660 /dev/cdrom /mount/point
i dont think it is a 9660 it says on it to mount -t cdfs-o noversion /dev/rx*c /dev/cdrom i dont understand this
have you seen the manpage for mount?
yes call me dumb but man pages seem to alud me in meaning
the basic syntax for mount is: mount -t fstype /dev/ice /mount/point
does ubuntu handle cdfs as it says and is that /dev/ice or /dev/device
/dev/ice is for you to understand, but masically you mount a device to a mount point
not really sure, shouldn't the cd automount anyway?
are you running within a VM?
are you using vmware?
yes open vms
your cdrom should be linked to the virtual cdrom ...
booting the emulator now and vms so thanks alot
so you have an os (ubuntu?) in vms, correct? if so, then ubuntu should see a regular cd drive as vms is supposed to 'fool' it into doing so
dont understand i am running simh in fc6 it runs the vms
what do you have inside of openvms?
nothing i am running linux first then running vms inside it
I see ...
how would i do it your way
openvms runs just inside linux?
a good place to ask would be the openvms people ...
i would have to go to the forums the channels are dead no one there so thanks for your help
np :-\
